http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0,23663,20840783-10388,00.html...
data.text:
Heath loves to say f***, how do people feel about the use of swear words in TDK?

http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0,23663,20840783-10388,00.html

Wedding bells for Heath?

From correspondents in Brooklyn

November 29, 2006 09:00am

HEATH Ledger and Michelle Williams are getting married, it has been claimed.

The Australian actor was allegedly spotted picking up a marriage licence with his 26-year-old actress fiance - who is the mother of his one-year-old daughter Matilda - in Brooklyn.

The pair met while they were filming gay cowboy film Brokeback Mountain and recently bought a townhouse together in the New York district.

Representatives for the couple have refused to comment on wedding rumours. Heath - who will play The Joker in the next Batman movie The Dark Knight - has previously gushed about how grateful he is to have a family, saying Michelle and their child make him happier than being a movie star.

He said: "I'm incredibly grateful to be a successful actor, and it kind of blows me away sometimes.

"But it's actually less about waking up and thinking how lucky I am to have this family, right now.

"That, for me, blows my mind. A billion times more that anything else. It's like, everything else? Who gives a f***?

DeFett said:

Heath loves to say f***, how do people feel about the use of swear words in TDK?

I wouldn't mind if they cuss in TDK but then again I really don't care. It's not going to make a big difference in the film. Really it won't make ANY difference.

Heath's Australian, profanity and bad language is alot more acceptable between friends and family in Australia. F**k is like saying damn.

I'm pretty sure my mum would slap me if she heard me say that in place of "damn" though I sort of get where you're coming from, a lot of swear words do seem to have become sort of colloquial terms down here.

I sure hope Joker doesn't use slang in Batman because to me he's a much more elevated form of bad guy. It'd be alright if say Joker's henchmen use it. But really now, any idiot can say the f-word. Joker is above that sort of thing. He doesn't say "I'm gonna f*** you up". He just f***s you up, while telling a rabi joke or something.

Eastwood said:

no swearing i mean there is no need for it it is a batman film comeon

oh, come on. one of the best lines in Burton's Batman was "I say, you're full of s**t, Knox. You can quote me on that."

you can't completely cut out the possibilty of swearing because Bats deals with some rough, scummy guys. those guys tend to swear.
